snippet: The agreement comes four months after the city comptroller’s office embarked on a campaign to give shareholders the right to hire and fire board members at 75 companies.
abstract: New York City comptroller's office reaches deals with Whiting Petroleum, Big Lots, McKesson Corp, Staples and Abercrombie & Fitch regarding proxy access, which would allow certain shareholders to make nominations for board of directors.
lead_paragraph: The agreement comes four months after the city comptroller’s office embarked on a campaign to give shareholders the right to hire and fire board members at 75 companies.

headline.main: City Comptroller Reaches Deals With 5 Companies on Giving Shareholders Say on Directors
headline.print_headline: Stringer and 5 Companies Reach Deals on Boards
